Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: glazed black; exterior: in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of ram (part of head with added white horn, neck with added red, shoulder and forelegs remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The dating, 525-500 BC in CVA seems low. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p. 51, no. 11, pl. 166)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 411, no. B629)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1402) (phase 3)
